<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 920, 120]]<|/det|>
A cloud chamber can be used to detect \(\alpha\) (alpha)-particles and \(\beta\) (beta)-particles. Alcohol in the cloud chamber exists as a vapour and condenses on ions produced in the air. This forms visible tracks.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 133, 920, 167]]<|/det|>
Fig. 10.1 shows the tracks when a source of \(\alpha\)-particles and \(\beta\)-particles is present in the cloud chamber.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[176, 173, 819, 425]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[460, 435, 537, 454]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 10.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 466, 774, 485]]<|/det|>
Some of the tracks are short and thick. Other tracks are longer and thinner.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 497, 920, 531]]<|/det|>
State and explain which tracks are produced by \(\alpha\)-particles and which tracks are produced by \(\beta\)-particles.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 545, 917, 562]]<|/det|>
\(\alpha\) -particles ...................................................................................................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 605, 917, 623]]<|/det|>
\(\beta\) -particles ...................................................................................................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[870, 637, 920, 655]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 668, 146, 686]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 667, 920, 717]]<|/det|>
A radioactive isotope of sodium (Na) is used to detect leaks from water pipes. A nucleus of this isotope of sodium contains 11 protons and 13 neutrons. This nucleus decays by emitting a \(\beta\)-particle to form a nucleus of magnesium (Mg).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 730, 181, 748]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[196, 730, 510, 748]]<|/det|>
Describe what is meant by an isotope.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[870, 821, 920, 839]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 72, 180, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 71, 905, 89]]<|/det|>
Write down the nuclide equation for the decay of this isotope of sodium to magnesium.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 210, 920, 229]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 242, 180, 260]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 241, 920, 275]]<|/det|>
This isotope of sodium has a half-life of 15 hours. The isotope of magnesium is stable and does not undergo radioactive decay.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 287, 920, 321]]<|/det|>
Suggest why these properties of the isotope of sodium and the isotope of magnesium make this isotope of sodium suitable to detect leaks from water pipes.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[833, 411, 920, 429]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[833, 428, 920, 447]]<|/det|>
<mark>[Total: 10]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 413, 920, 463]]<|/det|>
Electrical power is transmitted at a voltage of \(400\mathrm{kV}.\) A transformer reduces the voltage to \(33\mathrm{kV}\) for use by heavy industry in large factories. The number of turns on the primary coil of the transformer is 11 000.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 475, 737, 494]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[433, 647, 920, 664]]<|/det|>
